summary: This document is an email chain from November 2021 regarding the criminal case US v. Maxwell. It concerns a motion to quash a Rule 17(c) subpoena filed by an unnamed individual (Ms. [redacted]), with the defense's response pending. The correspondence involves scheduling inquiries for oral argument at a final pre-trial conference.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The Honorable Judge presiding over the case US v. Maxwell. Her chambers issued the attached court order and are the recipient of the email correspondence regarding the motion to quash.

events.title: Final Pre-Trial Conference in US v. Maxwell
events.description: A final pre-trial conference was scheduled for 9:30 am. The email correspondence inquires whether the Court intends to hear oral argument on a motion to quash at this conference.

events.title: Filing of Motion to Quash Subpoena
events.description: An unnamed individual (Ms. [redacted]) filed a motion to quash a subpoena issued to the defendant under Rule 17(c) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure. The motion and exhibits were submitted under temporary seal.

keyFacts: The document is part of the case US v. Maxwell (docket 20cr330).
A motion to quash a Rule 17(c) subpoena was filed by an unnamed individual (referred to as 'Ms.') on behalf of the defendant, Ghislaine Maxwell.
The defense had not yet filed its response to the motion to quash as of November 22, 2021.
The motion and its exhibits were submitted under temporary seal.
The correspondence seeks clarification on whether oral argument on the motion would be heard at the final pre-trial conference scheduled for November 24, 2021.
